td.p: WHEREAS Mitsui Chemicals is one of the world's leading petrochemical manufacturer and is driving forward its Next-Generation Business with deep-sighted focus on new business segments like Energy Solution Business, Medical Solution Business, IoT Solution Business and many more. As a next step forward Mitsui Chemicals through its affiliated company Mitsui Chemicals India Pvt. Ltd is bringing services for Solar industry in India.

WHEREAS both the above-mentioned companies are entering into this Agreement for the purpose of Solar PV Lab Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) Testing Facilities being undertaken by the MCIND and by signing of this Agreement, the Contracting Party is hereby agreeing to the terms below.
b. “Completion Date” means the date so referred to in Annexure A and/or agreed to by the Parties.

c. “Confidential Information” means any information about the names of past, present or prospective clients of the Company, any information pertaining to business of the company, trade or business secrets, financial information, pricing policies and procedures or any formula used in the Company of its Group or any Clients thereof or their affairs;
d. “Effective Date” shall mean the date from which this Agreement shall come into force and on the date it is so executed;
e. “Completion Date” shall mean the date on which the Project as stipulated in this Agreement is completed.

f. “Intellectual Property” means all intellectual and industrial property and all rights therein including, improvements, developments, discoveries, proprietary information; trademarks, , trade names, websites, Internet domain names, logos, trade secrets, processes, designs (whether or not registrable and whether or not design rights subsist in them), works in which copyright may subsist (including computer software and preparatory and design materials therefore).
g. Month: A month as per the English Calendar constituting either 30 or 31 days or 30 days continuing period shall be considered a calendar Month.
h. Week: Continuing period of 7 days shall be considered a week.

i. “Storage Costs” shall mean the amount spent over the storage or holding of inventory including the cost of warehouse utilities, material handling personnel, equipment maintenance, building maintenance, and security personnel.
k. “Working Hours” shall mean working 8 hours in a working day;
This Agreement shall be binding for a period as referred to Annexure A.

Mitsui Chemicals India Private Limited ,Mitsui Chemicals is one of the world's leading petrochemical manufacturer and is driving forward its Next-Generation Business with deep-sighted focus on new business segments like Energy Solution Business, Medical Solution Business, IoT Solution Business and many more. As a next step forward Mitsui Chemicals through its affiliated company Mitsui Chemicals India Private Limited (‘MCIND’ in short) is bringing services for Solar industry in India.

MCIND together with PI Berlin has recognized the needs of solar industry, so MCIND is expanding its business by launching a World Class PV testing lab with wide spectrum of services for ensuring quality from factory to field.

The MCIND has an IEC/ISO 17025:2017 BIS recognized test laboratory at Ahmedabad location in the State of Gujarat for evaluating the performance, reliability and durability of solar modules. Modules are tested according to strict criteria that meet or exceed IEC standards.
Both the Party are collectively called as “Parties” and individually “Party” with respect to the services rendered by MCIND to the Customer.
Scope of work is as per below-

Estimated Duration of complete schedule shall be based upon receipt of samples acceptable to perform test and release of balance payment from customer whichever is later. The Schedule may be referred to in Annexure A.

div.p: 1. This offer is exclusive of following applicable taxes & duties for testing services, as on date of this offer:
 All govt. statutory fees and duties
2. Travel costs are not included and will be charged to the Customer additionally, if applicable as mentioned in Clause 10.2

3. After a period of 12 weeks, in the case of BIS certification solar lab testing MCIND charges the customer storage fees of INR1000 for each m² per day, shall be applicable. However, if the customer is to make a request for a specific test other than BIS testing, then after a period of 4 weeks the customer storage fees of INR1000 for each m² per day, shall be applicable ( Details in section 10.1)

4. All additional cost/s due to statutory variation and/ or any increase of taxes and duties and in the event of introduction of any new taxes such as duties, cess and levies in the future, these will be payable extra to MCIND by the customer.
5. Any change in scope of work shall be subjected to extra cost which shall be mutually agreed and discussed between the parties.

6. All payments dueunder this contract shall be made free from all deductions, except for the deductions made for the purpose of withholding income taxes at the applicable tax rate/s as per the laws of India, if applicable. In the event that any income taxes are withheld by Customer and paid to the government treasury in respect of any payment made to MCIND under this contract, Customer shall duly forward the relevant tax credit certificate evidencing payment of such income taxes to MCIND.

strong.b: 10. 1. Delivery of Modules and other Equipment to MCIND Laboratory

td.p: If there are any questions regarding the transportation of the goods, please approach to contact person at MCIND .
Shipping address

Mitsui Chemicals India Private Limited Offer no. : MCIND/22-22/053.V1 Plot no. 5 &, Swastik Industrial Estate, Sarkhej-Bavla Highway, Village: Sari, Tal: Sanand, Dist: Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India. 382220
Pickup and delivery time of
The MCIND lab’s contact person , the telephone number and the offer number shall be included in the shipping documents and in the delivery note.

MCIND is not responsible for any import duty costs comprising of custom duty, cess and IGST. If MCIND is charged by Custom’s Authority for import of modules, these costs shall be reimbursed by the Customer.

strong.b: Test Modules and other goods upon Completion

td.p: When the customer places the order, it can decide what is going to happen to the test modules / samples after completion. If no further agreements have been made, the following applies:
 The customer is responsible for the packaging, insurance and shipping costs.
 MCIND provides storage for PV modules and other goods for 12 weeks after sending the report. This 12 weeks’ storage is free of charge.
 After 12 weeks, MCIND charges the customer storage fees of INR 1000 for each m² per day.
 After 16 weeks, the modules will be disposed and the resulting costs together with the storage fees will be charged to the Customer.
After completion of 20 weeks, customer shall lose its ownership of test samples and MCIND lab shall be open to use the test samples as per lab’s discretion.
Travel costs are not included in the testing fees and shall be arranged by customer at its cost.
Flights
MCIND employees travel in economy class and endeavor to use the most effective and efficient connections possible.
Rental cars
If required, MCIND will rent a car that is suitable for the terrain of the site. Car rental charges along with other incidental costs like toll & parking fees will be added to the charges.
Public Transportation
Taxi fees and public transportation tickets will be charged for MCIND’s employees and transferring equipment.
Accommodation
MCIND’s employees shall be at the discretion to exercise a choice in accommodation wherein a minimum threshold of a 3 Star Accommodation shall be foreseen on actual basis.
Miscellaneous Costs
All other costs shall be paid by the customer on actual basis
Payment Milestones:
100% on work completion and invoicing within 10 days

The gross fee along with incidental expenses shall be payable within 10 working days of the billing date without deductions. Any delay in payment may result in delay in execution of supplies under the order accordingly. Further, an interest @ 18% p.a. with monthly rests will be payable in case of delayed payments from the date of milestones as stated above till the date of actual payment.
All prices are given as net prices. For services within India, GST (currently 18%) is applicable. MCIND’s GST number is 24AAFCM4312D1Z2
Bank Details:
Bank: HDFC Bank
IFSC: HDFC0001203

This offer is valid for 30 days from the date of submission. In case Customer doesn’t confirm its acceptance within 30 days period, then fresh proposal shall be submitted by MCIND as per mutually agreed terms and conditions .
The current applicable general terms and business conditions (GTC) are attached as Annexure-B.
If you have any concern about privacy or grievances at MCIND, please contact us with a thorough description and we will try to resolve the issue for you.

All notices, requests, demands or other communication required or permitted to be given under this contract and the provisions contained herein shall be in writing in English language and are effective upon delivery to the applicable Party (whether by mail, fax, personal delivery or otherwise) at the address, and marked to the attention of the person, indicated below:
a. If to the MCIND, at:

All information disclosed to MCIND shall be kept strictly confidential at all times. Dissemination of information shall be regulated and monitored on a need to know basis. MCIND has a comprehensive and secure information and documents management system that protects the integrity of their customer information.

Both Parties represent and affirm that they will comply with all applicable laws and regulations relating to anti-corruption and anti-bribery and will comply with all applicable laws and regulations .
The terms of this engagement shall be governed by Indian Law and Courts in Delhi shall have exclusive jurisdiction to hear any disputes arising out of this engagement.
a. The contracting parties shall endeavor to settle any disagreements amicably and swiftly [within a maximum of 30 (thirty) days].

b. All disputes arising between the parties shall then be settled under the provisions of the Indian Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and be governed by Laws of India, as amended from time to time. The Parties also agree that the seat of Arbitration proceedings shall be at New Delhi.

c. If the dispute concerns a company that is not headquartered in India, MCIND shall be free to institute legal proceedings at the contracting party’s principal place of business or at the competent court in New Delhi. The official language in court shall be English.
d. New Delhi shall be the exclusive place of jurisdiction for any complaints made against MCIND.

e. Should individual or several provisions of a contract or of the GTC be or become fully or partially invalid, this shall not affect the validity of the remaining provisions. The same shall apply in the event of a contractual gap.

This Agreement supersedes any prior or subsisting agreement, correspondence or arrangement, made between the Parties in and any such agreement(s) shall be deemed to have been terminated by mutual consent with effect from the Effective Date.

The failure of either Party hereto to exercise the rights, powers, or remedies under this contract and any delay by either party herein to exercise the rights, powers, or remedies under this contract shall not function as a waiver of such rights, powers, or remedies. Any exercise made on an occasion or partial exercise by either Party hereto of a right, power, or remedy shall not preclude such Party from exercising on any other occasion or further exercising such rights, powers, or remedies. Even if either Party expressly waives the right to violation or non-observance of the conditions hereof or expressly admits such violation or non-observance, such waiver or admission shall not be deemed to have waived the rights that the Party is accorded with regard to subsequent violations or non-observance of such conditions or any other conditions hereof, or to have permitted subsequent violations or non-observances.

This contract constitutes entire contract between the Parties hereto and shall supersede all previous negotiations, agreements, understandings (whether in writing or otherwise) and commitments, whether formal or informal, oral or written, with respect to the subject matter hereto.
This contract shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns.

The Customer(s) hereby agree not to solicit the Company's clients, employees or customers for their own benefit or for the benefit of a competitor after the lapse or termination of this Agreement, for a period of one year.

This offer is explicitly created and provided to the addressed party. The contents of this offer shall not be shared with any third party without the written consent of MCIND. This offer is only binding when signed by an Authorized Signatory / Representative of MCIND. Any warranties, supplements, changes and amendments to contracts must be made in writing; the written form requirement can only be waived in writing in individual cases.

td.strong: Review of test samples and Pre conditioning/Stabilization

td.p: *Estimated duration of timeline is based upon following,
1. Delivery of samples
2. Receipt of Advance payment.
3. Successful generation of test request on BIS portal with QR code
In case of any delay in above mentioned, it will account to variation in timelines of project.

TPlease read these conditions carefully (collectively referred to as the “GTC”) before entering into an agreement with the MCIND. By using the MCIND website/application or digital platform, the Contracting Party signifies its agreement to be bound by these conditions. In addition to these general terms and conditions of use, when the Contracting Party use any current or future MCIND Content/Service, you will also be subjected to specific terms, guidelines and conditions applicable to that Service and if these conditions are inconsistent with such Terms, them those specific Terms will uphold. The following "Terms and Conditions" constitute an electronic record within the meaning of the applicable law. This electronic record is generated by a computer system and does not require any physical or digital signatures. Violation of the terms or this agreement constitute an unauthorized use of the MCIND website and applications and may give rise to an actionable cause/claim of MCIND or its affiliates against the violator.

h4.b: I. VALIDITY OF THE GTC and SEVERANCE OF CLAUSES:

td.p: If any of these conditions is deemed invalid, void, or for any reason unenforceable, that condition will be deemed severable and will not affect the validity and enforceability of any remaining conditions.

a. You agree that you are making use of our Services, at your own risk, and that hey are being provided to you on an “AS IS” and “AS AVAILABLE” basis. All goods supplied and services provided by MCIND shall be subject to:
i. countersigned quotations;
ii. upon delivery of test objects; or
iii. upon confirmation of order either in writing or via any other mode of communication, in coexistence with the following GTC.
b. Regardless of whether they were expressly objected, contracting parties’ terms and conditions that deviate from the GTC shall not be binding.

c. The above shall also apply if performance of the services is affected without reservation in the knowledge that the Contracting Party’s terms and conditions deviate from or conflict with these GTC.
d. These terms and conditions shall be considered to be accepted by the contracting party at the latest upon acceptance of MCIND’s performance of the services.

a. The Contracting Party shall ensure that any sort of documentation that it broadcasts to MCIND are free from third-party rights (specifically copyrights, and patent, brand and registered design rights).

b. Additionally, the Contracting Party shall indemnify and hold harmless MCIND, its subsidiaries, affiliates and their respective officers, Directors, agents and employees against any liability for claims or demands made by third parties and bear any damages arising out of your breach of these GTC or any document incorporated by reference, or your violation of any law, rules, regulations or the rights of a third party.

c. The Contracting Party hereby expressly release MCIND and/or its affiliates and/or any of its officers and representatives from any cost, damage, liability or other consequence of any of the actions/inactions of the Service Partners, Members or vendors and specifically waiver any claims or demands that the Contracting Party may have in this behalf under any statute, contract or otherwise.

h4.b: III. QUOTATIONS AND SCOPE OF PERFORMANCE

td.p: a. In accordance with law, pending quotations shall be subject to change for our services being rendered.
b. The magnitude of obligations owed by the service provider shall be based exclusively on the confirmation of MCIND or the contract.
a. This Agreement shall be valid for a period as referred to in the Annexure A.
b. Deadlines for completing the contract shall only be binding if agreed in writing.

c. At no time shall any right, title or interest vest with MCIND nor shall MCIND have any obligations or liabilities in respect of any transactions. The Contracting Party shall fulfill all the obligations that must be met before the contract can be performed, properly and in due time.

a. If an act of force majeure prevents MCIND from rendering services or supplying goods on time, then MCIND shall not be liable for any damages incurred as a result thereof for the duration of the disturbance or delay.

b. MCIND shall be entitled to terminate the contract if the circumstances warranting the act of force majeure continue for more than a month. In this case, the contracting party shall not be entitled to claim for damages. Mitsui Chemicals India Pvt. Ltd. shall be remunerated for any expenses incurred up until this point.

a. The Contracting Party shall ensure that any images, drawings, calculations, technical information and other documentation that it transmits to MCIND are free from any third-party rights (in particular copyrights incurred, patent, brand and design right);
b. The Contracting Party shall indemnify MCIND against any liability for claims made by third parties and bear any damages incurred as a result thereof.

h4.b: VII. PRICING AND TERMS OF PAYMENT

td.p: a. We further expressly disclaim any warranties or representations in respect of quality, suitability, accuracy, reliability, timeliness, performance, safety, merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or legality of the products.

b. Unless otherwise agreed, the agreed price shall not include GST (calculated at the rate valid on the invoicing date), and shall be payable within ten working days of the billing date without deductions. In the event of delayed payment, the invoiced amount shall be subject to interest at 18% per annum. This shall not affect any higher compensation claims arising from the default.
c. Agreed prices shall not include transportation costs, i.e. costs for packaging, transport insurance and import duty which shall include Customs duty and IGST;
d. MCIND shall charge the contracting party for transportation costs. Transport insurance shall only be provided at the contracting party’s request, duly made in writing;

e. Travel expenses, accommodation expenses and any other out of pocket expenses shall be paid by the Contracting Party to MCIND in accordance with the terms and conditions and as per the daily man day charges;

f. MCIND shall receive information about the contracting party’s illiquidity (e.g. failure to pay due and overdue payments, registered insolvency), it shall be entitled to refuse further performance until counter-performance is affected.
g. The Contracting Party may only offset debts against counterclaims which are uncontested by MCIND or legally established counterclaims.
h. The Contracting Party shall only be entitled to exercise rights of retention if counterclaims are based on the same contract.

a. Mitsui Chemicals India Pvt. Ltd. reserves the right of ownership of all contractual performance until the Contracting Party has fulfilled all of its outstanding claims arising from the business relationship.

b. If the Contracting Party breaches its duties, in particular through a delay in payment to MCIND, MCIND shall serve a 15 days’ notice period, post which, MCIND shal be entitled to terminate the contract and return any documentation provided.

h4.b: IX. INDEPENDENT RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE PARTIES

td.p: Both the Parties are independent entities and any clause of this contract should not be construed to mean or establish any relation of principal-agent between the Parties. The relationship between both the Parties is on Principal to principal basis and in no way the conduct of one Party bound the other in any manner whatsoever. The obligation arising from this contract is independent and for the act and/or omission of one Party the other shall not held to be responsible.

Each Party is and will remain an independent party with respect to all performance rendered pursuant to this contract. No party will be considered as an agent of the other Party for any purpose and will have no authority to bind or make commitments on behalf of such other Party for any purpose and shall not hold itself or themselves out as having such authority.

Nothing in this contract will be construed as creating a partnership between the Parties and neither Party shall have the authority or power to bind the other Party or to contract in the name of or create a liability against the other Party in any way or for any purpose.
a. MCIND shall only be liable for special features of the performance of the services as contracted if such features were agreed in writing.
b. MCIND shall remedy or replace defected goods or deficient performance at its discretion.

c. The limitation period for claims for defects shall expire after a period of three months post the contract has been performed. This shall not apply if defects were concealed fraudulently or in the event of injury to life, limb or health.

d. The Contracting Party is required to inspect goods for defects and services for deficiencies without delay and report them within two weeks of receipt. Claims for defects made after the above-mentioned period shall not be considered. Contracting Party(ies) must notify MCIND of any “hidden” defects in writing within two weeks of becoming aware thereof.
e. Such defects shall only be considered to be reported if the deviation between the actual and the agreed condition is described in a comprehensible manner.
a. MCIND shall not accept any liability if performance of the contract encroaches on third-party industrial property rights.

a. Liability for breaches of duties committed by MCIND or its representatives and contractual assistant agents, shall be limited to willful or negligent breaches of duties unless defects were concealed fraudulently or a warranty was granted.

b. Liability for gross negligence shall be limited to foreseeable damages typical for this type of contract. The Contracting Party shall not be entitled to make any further or other claims, particularly as a result of consequential damages. This shall not apply in the event of injury to life, limb or health.
c. Liability shall be limited to the relevant contract value only;

d. If the object of the contract is to perform work and services related to crystalline solar modules (c-Si), liability shall be capped at INR 18/W p or, if related to other solar modules, in particular thin-film solar modules, at INR 17/W p ;

e. Any test objects (e.g. modules) provided to MCIND by the contracting party shall be returned after completion of the contract. MCIND shall not be liable for compensation if modules are damaged or destroyed with no external forces, or only external forces caused by slight negligence, being involved.
f. The obligation to return shall be deemed to be fulfilled if 90% (ninety percent) of the modules are returned.

g. MCIND shall only be liable for compensation if evidence is provided of the extent of damage claimed. By way of precaution, MCIND hereby rejects any generalized compensation provisions, regardless of the contracting party’s legal grounds.
h. Production yield losses are consequential damages for which MCIND shall not be held liable by its contracting parties.
a. The contracting party shall be obliged to take back test modules and any other objects provided.

b. If the Contracting Party fails to meet its obligations to take back goods despite having been provided with a deadline, MCIND shall be entitled to sell the modules/objects, or store or destroy them at the Contracting Party’s expense.
a. If consultancy services are provided, they shall be subject to the additional GTC in this paragraph:
i. MCIND organizes its activities independently and is not bound to any particular location or working hours (except with respect to operational matters).
ii. MCIND is entitled to turn down additional orders placed by the contracting party without specifying a reason.
iii. MCIND may perform services itself or through specialist third parties, after obtaining prior written consent from the Contracting Party.
iv. MCIND shall have the liberty to work for other customers, even if they are in competition to the Contracting Party.

b. MCIND shall provide consultancy services in compliance with generally recognized industry standards, but shall not be responsible if the project goal is not achieved. Services and intermediate stages shall therefore not be subject to acceptance.
a. The Contracting Party(ies) agree to treat all provided information of a technical or business nature with confidentiality during, as well as after termination of, work performed.
b. This shall not apply to information that demonstrably:
i. is or became common knowledge through no fault of the receiver;
ii. is publicly available or becomes publicly available through no fault of MCIND;
iii. was known before it was received;
iv. is already in the lawful possession of MCIND without restriction prior to disclosure to MCIND;
v. is at any developed independently by MCIND;
vii. has been exempted from these obligations in writing; or

viii. had to be disclosed pursuant to applicable law or an order from court of Competent Jurisdiction (in which case the receiving party – if obliged to disclose this information – must notify the disclosing party in writing and without delay of its duty to disclose the information).
c. Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, the obligation of confidentiality shall be valid for five years.
d. The Contracting Party(ies) shall only become the owner of the contractually agreed performance outcomes and associated rights of use upon full payment of the agreed purchase price.

e. The right to use performance outcomes shall be limited to internal purposes only. These outcomes may only be disclosed to third parties following written approval from MCIND, or to those legally bound to maintain confidentiality.

f. Unless otherwise agreed at the time the order was placed or unless required to fulfill the purpose of the contract, written approval must be obtained from MCIND before information is processed, passed on, sublicensed, published, distributed and/or reproduced on electronic data carriers.
g. MCIND shall be entitled to use contractual relationships as a reference both online and offline, stating the name of the customer and the project.

h. Without prior written consent from MCIND, the Contracting Party shall not use the trademark-protected name MCIND or the associated logo in online or offline presentations, publications, marketing material, on websites or in any other way.

i. The Contracting Party must obtain prior approval before making any publications related to MCIND. Such publications may only contain objective information about MCIND, facts and conclusive results.
a. The right to ordinary termination of the contract shall be excluded. However, the right to terminate with cause shall remain unaffected.

b. In the event that the contract is terminated with cause, MCIND shall within four weeks provide the contracting party with the results of the inspection and/or consultation obtained up until the point the notice was issued, but not before payment of the pro rata remuneration.
c. The contracting party agrees to remunerate MCIND for any costs, works and services incurred before expiry of the contractual period of notice.
d. Each Party shall serve a notice period of 14 (“Fourteen”) days before terminating the contract.

a. The contracting parties shall endeavor to replace any fully or partially invalid provision with a legally permissible provision that will achieve the economic result that should have been achieved by the invalid provision.
b. The assignment of rights or transfer of duties arising from a contract requires prior written approval.
c. Any warranties, supplements, changes and amendments to contracts must be made in writing; the written form requirement can only be waived in writing in individual cases.
